012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.lang.reflect.Field;
015import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
016import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isPublic;
017import static java.lang.reflect.Modifier.isStatic;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Array;
020
021import java.sql.Connection;
022import static java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection;
023import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
024import java.sql.ResultSet;
025import java.sql.ResultSetMetaData;
026import java.sql.Types;
027import static java.sql.Types.VARCHAR;
028
029import java.sql.SQLException;
030import java.sql.SQLDataException;
031import java.sql.SQLNonTransientException;
032
033import java.util.Arrays;
034
035import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
036import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
037import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLType;
038
039import org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation.ConditionalDDR; // for javadoc
040
041/**
042 * A class to simplify testing of PL/Java's mappings between PostgreSQL and
043 * Java/JDBC types.
044 *<p>
045 * Provides one function, {@link #roundTrip roundTrip()}. Its single input
046 * parameter is an unspecified row type, so you can pass it a row that has
047 * exactly one column of any type.
048 *<p>
049 * Its return type is also an unspecified row type, so you need to follow the
050 * function call with a column definition list of up to six columns. Each
051 * requested output column must have its name (case-insensitively) and type
052 * drawn from this table:
053 *<table>
054 *<caption>Items the roundTrip function can return</caption>
055 *<thead>
056 *<tr>
057 *<th>Column name</th><th>Column type</th><th>What is returned</th>
058 *</tr>
059 *</thead>
060 *<tbody>
061 *<tr>
062 *<td>TYPEPG</td><td>any text/varchar</td><td>The PostgreSQL type name</td>
063 *</tr>
064 *<tr>
065 *<td>TYPEJDBC</td><td>any text/varchar</td><td>The JDBC Types constant</td>
066 *</tr>
067 *<tr>
068 *<td>CLASSJDBC</td><td>any text/varchar</td>
069 *<td>Name of the Java class JDBC claims (in metadata) it will instantiate</td>
070 *</tr>
071 *<tr>
072 *<td>CLASS</td><td>any text/varchar</td>
073 *<td>Name of the Java class JDBC did instantiate</td>
074 *</tr>
075 *<tr>
076 *<td>TOSTRING</td><td>any text/varchar</td>
077 *<td>Result of {@code toString()} on the object returned by
078 * {@code ResultSet.getObject()} ({@code Arrays.toString} if it is a primitive
079 * array, {@code Arrays.deepToString} if an array of reference type)</td>
080 *</tr>
081 *<tr>
082 *<td>ROUNDTRIPPED</td><td>same as input column</td>
083 *<td>Result of passing the object returned by {@code ResultSet.getObject()}
084 * directly to {@code ResultSet.updateObject()}</td>
085 *</tr>
086 *</tbody>
087 *</table>
088 *<p>
089 * Serving suggestion:
090 *<pre>
091 *SELECT
092 *  orig = roundtripped AS good, *
093 *FROM
094 *  (VALUES (timestamptz '2017-08-21 18:25:29.900005Z')) AS p(orig),
095 *  roundtrip(p) AS (roundtripped timestamptz);
096 *</pre>
097 *<p>
098 * This example relies on {@code implementor} tags reflecting the PostgreSQL
099 * version, set up in the {@link ConditionalDDR} example.
100 */
101@SQLAction(implementor = "postgresql_ge_90300", // funcs see earlier FROM items
102    requires = {"TypeRoundTripper.roundTrip", "point mirror type"},
103    install = {
104    " SELECT" +
105    "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
106    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'timestamp roundtrip passes')" +
107    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'timestamp roundtrip fails')" +
108    "  END" +
109    " FROM" +
110    "  (VALUES" +
111    "   (timestamp '2017-08-21 18:25:29.900005')," +
112    "   (timestamp '1970-03-07 17:37:49.300009')," +
113    "   (timestamp '1919-05-29 13:08:33.600001')" +
114    "  ) AS p(orig)," +
115    "  roundtrip(p) AS (roundtripped timestamp)",
116
117    " SELECT" +
118    "  CASE WHEN every(orig = roundtripped)" +
119    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'timestamptz roundtrip passes')" +
120    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'timestamptz roundtrip fails')" +
121    "  END" +
122    " FROM" +
123    "  (VALUES" +
124    "   (timestamptz '2017-08-21 18:25:29.900005Z')," +
125    "   (timestamptz '1970-03-07 17:37:49.300009Z')," +
126    "   (timestamptz '1919-05-29 13:08:33.600001Z')" +
127    "  ) AS p(orig)," +
128    "  roundtrip(p) AS (roundtripped timestamptz)",
129
130    " SELECT" +
131    "  CASE WHEN classjdbc = 'org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation.Point'" +
132    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'issue192 test passes')" +
133    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'issue192 test fails')" +
134    "  END" +
135    " FROM" +
136    "  (VALUES (point '0,0')) AS p," +
137    "  roundtrip(p) AS (classjdbc text)",
138
139    " SELECT" +
140    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
141    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'boolean[] passes')" +
142    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'boolean[] fails')" +
143    "  END" +
144    " FROM" +
145    "  (SELECT '{t,null,f}'::boolean[]) AS p(orig)," +
146    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Boolean;'), ('[Z')) as q(rqcls)," +
147    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped boolean[])," +
148    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
149    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
150    "   AND roundtripped =" +
151    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, false)" +
152    "   ELSE orig END" +
153    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
154
155    " SELECT" +
156    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
157    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    '\"char\"[] passes')" +
158    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', '\"char\"[] fails')" +
159    "  END" +
160    " FROM" +
161    "  (SELECT '{A,null,B}'::\"char\"[]) AS p(orig)," +
162    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Byte;'), ('[B')) as q(rqcls)," +
163    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped \"char\"[])," +
164    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
165    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
166    "   AND roundtripped =" +
167    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, 0::\"char\")" +
168    "   ELSE orig END" +
169    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
170
171    " SELECT" +
172    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
173    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'bytea passes')" +
174    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'bytea fails')" +
175    "  END" +
176    " FROM" +
177    "  (SELECT '\\x010203'::bytea) AS p(orig)," +
178    "  (VALUES (''), ('[B')) as q(rqcls)," +
179    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped bytea)," +
180    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
181    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
182    "   AND roundtripped = orig" +
183    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
184
185    " SELECT" +
186    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
187    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'int2[] passes')" +
188    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'int2[] fails')" +
189    "  END" +
190    " FROM" +
191    "  (SELECT '{1,null,3}'::int2[]) AS p(orig)," +
192    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Short;'), ('[S')) as q(rqcls)," +
193    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped int2[])," +
194    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
195    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
196    "   AND roundtripped =" +
197    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, 0::int2)" +
198    "   ELSE orig END" +
199    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
200
201    " SELECT" +
202    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
203    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'int4[] passes')" +
204    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'int4[] fails')" +
205    "  END" +
206    " FROM" +
207    "  (SELECT '{1,null,3}'::int4[]) AS p(orig)," +
208    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Integer;'), ('[I')) as q(rqcls)," +
209    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped int4[])," +
210    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
211    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
212    "   AND roundtripped =" +
213    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, 0::int4)" +
214    "   ELSE orig END" +
215    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
216
217    " SELECT" +
218    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
219    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'int8[] passes')" +
220    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'int8[] fails')" +
221    "  END" +
222    " FROM" +
223    "  (SELECT '{1,null,3}'::int8[]) AS p(orig)," +
224    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Long;'), ('[J')) as q(rqcls)," +
225    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped int8[])," +
226    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
227    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
228    "   AND roundtripped =" +
229    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, 0::int8)" +
230    "   ELSE orig END" +
231    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
232
233    " SELECT" +
234    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
235    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'float4[] passes')" +
236    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'float4[] fails')" +
237    "  END" +
238    " FROM" +
239    "  (SELECT '{1,null,3}'::float4[]) AS p(orig)," +
240    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Float;'), ('[F')) as q(rqcls)," +
241    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped float4[])," +
242    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
243    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
244    "   AND roundtripped =" +
245    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, 0::float4)" +
246    "   ELSE orig END" +
247    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
248
249    " SELECT" +
250    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
251    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'float8[] passes')" +
252    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'float8[] fails')" +
253    "  END" +
254    " FROM" +
255    "  (SELECT '{1,null,3}'::float8[]) AS p(orig)," +
256    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.Double;'), ('[D')) as q(rqcls)," +
257    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped float8[])," +
258    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
259    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
260    "   AND roundtripped =" +
261    "   CASE WHEN class LIKE '[_' THEN array_replace(orig, null, 0::float8)" +
262    "   ELSE orig END" +
263    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
264
265    " SELECT" +
266    "  CASE WHEN every(outcome.ok)" +
267    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'text[] passes')" +
268    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'text[] fails')" +
269    "  END" +
270    " FROM" +
271    "  (SELECT '{foo,null,bar}'::text[]) AS p(orig)," +
272    "  (VALUES (''), ('[Ljava.lang.String;')) as q(rqcls)," +
273    "  roundtrip(p, rqcls) AS (class text, roundtripped text[])," +
274    "  LATERAL (SELECT" +
275    "   (rqcls = class OR rqcls = '')" +
276    "   AND roundtripped = orig" +
277    "  ) AS outcome(ok)",
278    }
279)
280public class TypeRoundTripper
281{
282    private TypeRoundTripper() { }
283
284    /**
285     * Function accepting one parameter of row type (one column, any type)
286     * and returning a row with up to six columns (use a column definition list
287     * after the function call, choose column names from TYPEPG, TYPEJDBC,
288     * CLASSJDBC, CLASS, TOSTRING, ROUNDTRIPPED where any of the first five
289     * must have text/varchar type, while ROUNDTRIPPED must match the type of
290     * the input column).
291     * @param in The input row value (required to have exactly one column).
292     * @param classname Name of class to be explicitly requested (JDBC 4.1
293     * feature) from {@code getObject}; pass an empty string (the default) to
294     * make no such explicit request. Accepts the form {@code Class.getName}
295     * would produce: canonical names or spelled-out primitives if not an array
296     * type, otherwise prefix left-brackets and primitive letter codes or
297     * {@code L}<em>classname</em>{@code ;}.
298     * @param prepare Whether the object retrieved from {@code in} should be
299     * passed as a parameter to an identity {@code PreparedStatement} and the
300     * result of that be returned. If false (the default), the value from
301     * {@code in} is simply forwarded directly to {@code out}.
302     * @param out The output row (supplied by PL/Java, representing the column
303     * definition list that follows the call of this function in SQL).
304     * @throws SQLException if {@code in} does not have exactly one column, if
305     * {@code out} has more than six, if a requested column name in {@code out}
306     * is not among those recognized, if a column of {@code out} is not of its
307     * required type, or if other stuff goes wrong.
308     */
309    @Function(
310        schema = "javatest",
311        type = "RECORD",
312        provides = "TypeRoundTripper.roundTrip",
313        implementor = "postgresql_ge_80400" // supports function param DEFAULTs
314        )
315    public static boolean roundTrip(
316        ResultSet in, @SQLType(defaultValue="") String classname,
317        @SQLType(defaultValue="false") boolean prepare, ResultSet out)
318    throws SQLException
319    {
320        ResultSetMetaData inmd = in.getMetaData();
321        ResultSetMetaData outmd = out.getMetaData();
322
323        Class<?> clazz = null;
324        if ( ! "".equals(classname) )
325            clazz = loadClass(classname);
326
327        if ( 1 != inmd.getColumnCount() )
328            throw new SQLDataException(
329                "in parameter must be a one-column row type", "22000");
330
331        int outcols = outmd.getColumnCount();
332        if ( 6 < outcols )
333            throw new SQLDataException(
334                "result description may have no more than six columns",
335                "22000");
336
337        String inTypePG = inmd.getColumnTypeName(1);
338        int inTypeJDBC = inmd.getColumnType(1);
339        Object val = (null == clazz) ? in.getObject(1) : in.getObject(1, clazz);
340
341        if ( prepare )
342        {
343            Connection c = getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
344            PreparedStatement ps = c.prepareStatement("SELECT ?");
345            ps.setObject(1, val);
346            ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery();
347            rs.next();
348            val = (null == clazz) ? rs.getObject(1) : rs.getObject(1, clazz);
349            rs.close();
350            ps.close();
351            c.close();
352        }
353
354        for ( int i = 1; i <= outcols; ++ i )
355        {
356            String what = outmd.getColumnLabel(i);
357
358            if ( "TYPEPG".equalsIgnoreCase(what) )
359            {
360                assertTypeJDBC(outmd, i, VARCHAR);
361                out.updateObject(i, inTypePG);
362            }
363            else if ( "TYPEJDBC".equalsIgnoreCase(what) )
364            {
365                assertTypeJDBC(outmd, i, VARCHAR);
366                out.updateObject(i, typeNameJDBC(inTypeJDBC));
367            }
368            else if ( "CLASSJDBC".equalsIgnoreCase(what) )
369            {
370                assertTypeJDBC(outmd, i, VARCHAR);
371                out.updateObject(i, inmd.getColumnClassName(1));
372            }
373            else if ( "CLASS".equalsIgnoreCase(what) )
374            {
375                assertTypeJDBC(outmd, i, VARCHAR);
376                out.updateObject(i, val.getClass().getName());
377            }
378            else if ( "TOSTRING".equalsIgnoreCase(what) )
379            {
380                assertTypeJDBC(outmd, i, VARCHAR);
381                out.updateObject(i, toString(val));
382            }
383            else if ( "ROUNDTRIPPED".equalsIgnoreCase(what) )
384            {
385                if ( ! inTypePG.equals(outmd.getColumnTypeName(i)) )
386                    throw new SQLDataException(
387                    "Result ROUNDTRIPPED column must have same type as input",
388                        "22000");
389                out.updateObject(i, val);
390            }
391            else
392                throw new SQLDataException(
393                    "Output column label \""+ what + "\" should be one of: " +
394                    "TYPEPG, TYPEJDBC, CLASSJDBC, CLASS, TOSTRING, " +
395                    "ROUNDTRIPPED",
396                    "22000");
397        }
398
399        return true;
400    }
401
402    static void assertTypeJDBC(ResultSetMetaData md, int i, int t)
403    throws SQLException
404    {
405        if ( md.getColumnType(i) != t )
406            throw new SQLDataException(
407                "Result column " + i + " must be of JDBC type " +
408                typeNameJDBC(t));
409    }
410
411    static String typeNameJDBC(int t)
412    {
413        for ( Field f : Types.class.getFields() )
414        {
415            int m = f.getModifiers();
416            if ( isPublic(m) && isStatic(m) && int.class == f.getType() )
417                try
418                {
419                    if ( f.getInt(null) == t )
420                        return f.getName();
421                }
422                catch ( IllegalAccessException e ) { }
423        }
424        return String.valueOf(t);
425    }
426
427    private static Class<?> loadClass(String className)
428    throws SQLException
429    {
430        String noBrackets = className.replaceFirst("^\\[++", "");
431        int ndims = (className.length() - noBrackets.length());
432
433        /*
434         * The naming conventions from Class.getName() could hardly be less
435         * convenient. If *not* an array, it's the same as the canonical name,
436         * with the primitive names spelled out. If it *is* an array, the
437         * primitives get their one-letter codes, and other class names have L
438         * prefix and ; suffix. Condense the two cases here into one offbeat
439         * hybrid form that will be used below.
440         */
441        if ( 0 == ndims )
442            noBrackets =
443                ("L" + noBrackets +
444                ":booleanZ:byteB:shortS:charC:intI:longJ:floatF:doubleD")
445                .replaceFirst(
446                    "^L(\\w++)(?=:)(?:\\w*+:)*\\1(\\w)(?::.*+)?+$|:.++$",
447                    "$2");
448        else
449            noBrackets = noBrackets.replaceFirst(";$", "");
450
451        /*
452         * Invariant: thanks to the above normalization, whether array or not,
453         * noBrackets will now have this form: either the first (and only)
454         * character is one of the primitive character codes, or the first
455         * character is L and the rest is a class name (with no ; at the end).
456         */
457
458        Class<?> c;
459
460        switch ( noBrackets.charAt(0) )
461        {
462        case 'Z': c = boolean.class; break;
463        case 'B': c =    byte.class; break;
464        case 'S': c =   short.class; break;
465        case 'C': c =    char.class; break;
466        case 'I': c =     int.class; break;
467        case 'J': c =    long.class; break;
468        case 'F': c =   float.class; break;
469        case 'D': c =  double.class; break;
470        default:
471            try
472            {
473                noBrackets = noBrackets.substring(1);
474                c = Class.forName(noBrackets);
475            }
476            catch ( ClassNotFoundException e )
477            {
478                throw new SQLNonTransientException(
479                    "No such class: " + noBrackets, "46103", e);
480            }
481        }
482
483        if ( 0 != ndims )
484            c = Array.newInstance(c, new int[ndims]).getClass();
485
486        return c;
487    }
488
489    private static String toString(Object o)
490    {
491        if ( ! o.getClass().isArray() )
492            return o.toString();
493        if (Object[].class.isInstance(o))
494            return Arrays.deepToString(Object[].class.cast(o));
495        if (boolean[].class.isInstance(o))
496            return Arrays.toString(boolean[].class.cast(o));
497        if (byte[].class.isInstance(o))
498            return Arrays.toString(byte[].class.cast(o));
499        if (short[].class.isInstance(o))
500            return Arrays.toString(short[].class.cast(o));
501        if (int[].class.isInstance(o))
502            return Arrays.toString(int[].class.cast(o));
503        if (long[].class.isInstance(o))
504            return Arrays.toString(long[].class.cast(o));
505        if (char[].class.isInstance(o))
506            return Arrays.toString(char[].class.cast(o));
507        if (float[].class.isInstance(o))
508            return Arrays.toString(float[].class.cast(o));
509        if (double[].class.isInstance(o))
510            return Arrays.toString(double[].class.cast(o));
511        return null;
512    }
513}
